dict.string:
What's here:

All FITS files with no stars or targets in the image, as found by searching for FITS files with the AO loop open (AO off), then deleting open-loop user images, and also deleting all identifying info from FITS headers.
A table and text file lists the contents of each date's FITS files, which can be downloaded as gzipped-FITS in a zipped-up directory. Contact Katie Morzinski for help.

NOTES:

  • I've ordered the files by timestamp so that you can see if the Flats were taken at the beginning or the end of the night (times are in UT).
  • I've listed the filter and camera so that you can decide if it's the right Flat or Dark.
  • I've listed the x-y-z dimensions, integration time, and coadds so that you can determine if it's the right Dark, or if it will work to create a good Flat.
  • I've listed the average number of counts per coadd (or per frame in cubes) for each file, so that you can assess whether it is a useful "lights-on" or "lights-off" type Flat.
  • I've listed the detector temperature (keyword TEMP1 in header) and the optics temperature (TEMP2) so that you can compare them to the temperature of your data, to decide whether it's a valid Dark for your data.

Raw Calibration Files By Date

Calibration Data clio_20141101_02 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141102_03 - Darks; H Narrow Flats (Dusk) - start ~8000, end ~1000 counts/GOOD.
Calibration Data clio_20141103_04 - Darks; Linearity; 3.3 Narrow Flats (Dusk) - counts not falling/BAD - try Darks?
Calibration Data clio_20141105_06 - Darks; 3.3um Narrow Flats (Dawn) - start ~15,000, end ~18,000 counts/BAD.
Calibration Data clio_20141106_07 - Darks; H Narrow Flats (Dusk) - start saturated, eventually/OK-BAD.
Calibration Data clio_20141107_08 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141108_09 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141109_10 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141110_11 - Darks; L' Narrow Flats (Dusk) - counts didn't fall but took brighter (longer exposure) and fainter (shorter exposure) with corresponding Darks so could still use /OK; Ks Narrow Flats (Dawn) - #s 22-28 ~13,000-15,000 counts, falling to #s 11-17 ~5000-8000 counts/GOOD.
Calibration Data clio_20141111_12 - Darks; Linearity; Ks Narrow Flats (Dusk) - only got bias counts/BAD; L' Narrow Flats (Dusk) - count levels not falling (also took darks)/BAD-OK; H Narrow Flats (Dawn) - start ~6000 counts, end ~37,000 counts (and more - saturated later)/GOOD; Ks Narrow Flats (Dawn) - 13,000 counts - can subtract one from Dusk for "lights off"/GOOD.
Calibration Data clio_20141112_13 - Darks; Ks Narrow Flats/OK.
Calibration Data clio_20141113_14 - Darks; Experimental attempts at spectral flats (Dawn); L' Wide Flats (Dusk) - close to non-linear at minimum integration, no changing brightness levels possible/BAD; 3.1um Wide Flats (Dusk) - counts didn't fall/BAD; 3.1 um Wide Flats (Dawn) - counts didn't fall/BAD.
Calibration Data clio_20141114_15 - Darks; 3.1um Wide Flats (Dusk) - counts fell slightly but not to very low level/BAD-OK (also took Darks adjacently).
Calibration Data clio_20141115_16 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141116_17 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141117_18 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141118_19 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141119_20 - Darks; Linearity; Experimental: L' Wide Sky; M' Wide Sky - non-linear/BAD.
Calibration Data clio_20141120_21 - Darks; Linearity; Experimental: 3.1um, 3.3um, 3.9um, L', M' Wide Sky.
Calibration Data clio_20141125_26 - Darks; Experimental: L' Wide Sky - saturated/BAD; L' Narrow Sky.
Calibration Data clio_20141126_27 - Darks; H Narrow Flats (Dawn) - counts didn't change but took Darks/OK.
Calibration Data clio_20141127_28 - Darks; J, H, Ks Narrow Flats (Dusk) - counts did fall a bit as cycling between filters, also took corresponding Darks adjacently/GOOD-OK.
Calibration Data clio_20141128_29 - Darks; Experimental 3.1um, 3.3um, 3.9um Narrow Sky.
Calibration Data clio_20141129_30 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141130_01 - Darks.
Calibration Data clio_20141201_02 - Darks; H Narrow Flats; Ks Narrow Flats (Dusk) - counts did fall a bit and also took adjacent Darks/GOOD-OK.
Calibration Data clio_20141202_03 - Darks; Linearity.

NOTE: GOOD/BAD/OK designations of Flat data sets is according to the method I learned from Bruce Macintosh & Henry Roe of "Lights-on" minus "Lights-off" flats (at Keck where there are dome lamps) -- so to do it with Twilight Flats you want a set of brighter ones = "lights-on" and a set of darker ones = "lights-off" but with the same integration time so that you can subtract off the dome/sky thermal floor of scattered light from the on-axis flatfield.
Users may have other ways they wish to build flats, and may have their own opinions as to GOOD/BAD/OK.




How to prepare files for this page (note to self:)

Use write_clio_summary_calibrations.pro :
It reads in all the data for a particular directory, and only writes a summary of the files with AO loop open. It also deletes all identifying info from header, including all telescope pointing info, all user info, all catalog info.
Then check that file and cull it for user's data that was when the loop was open.
And post the zipped-FITS files here, remaining. These are the calibration files. (500 MB limit)




DETAILED STEPS (NOTE TO SELF:)
Prepare these calibration files as follows:

(Note: Takes about ~0.5-1 hour per day -- including waiting for computer to Zip up all the FITS files, and how slow it makes my computer - especially Finder - while it's doing this.)
(Maybe try turning off various backups - CrashPlan, TimeMachine - so that the backing up doesn't slow us down.)
(Also: Occasionally restart computer when Finder starts to slow down, that seems to help a lot.)


1) In IDL:
cd,'/Users/ktmorz/home/research/astronomy/magao/clio/n2014B'

2) In IDL:
write_clio_summary_calibrations, 'clio_20141103_04', 'clio_20141103_04cal.dat', '~/home/research/astronomy/magao/clio/calibrations/2014B/clio_20141103_04/'

3) Open the new text file called "clio_20141103_04cal.datwiki.dat" that was created in the above step. Delete all lines that contain a star/target name. Also scan the listing (it's in TimeStamp order) and check anything unusual like a lot of "Test" images that are actual data but we forgot to change the file name -- delete those too (check logs if necessary).

4) Go to the directory where the FITS files were zipped. Delete all of the FITS files for which you deleted the lines above (someday: re-write the SPAWN part of the code that Zips up the FITS files so that this happens automatically).

5) In IDL:
table2html, read='clio_20141103_04cal.datwiki.dat', write='clio_20141103_04cal.datwiki.html', /select

How to do the ASCII Template that pops up:
a) Click "2" for starting row (to get full data - right number of columns per cell --- and this also tells it the first row is the header)
b) Leave it checked on "Delimited"
c) Click "Next 100 rows" until that button grays out.
d) Click NEXT NEXT FINISH (You only have to select things on the first screen.)


6) Edit header to read:
<TABLE CLASS="data __useTableEditor">
<TR> <TH>TimeStamp </TH> <TH> FileName </TH> <TH> Filter </TH> <TH> Camera </TH> <TH> Nx </TH> <TH> Ny </TH> <TH> Nz </TH> <TH> Int [ms] </TH> <TH> Number of Coadds </TH> <TH> Counts per Coadd </TH> <TH> Detector Temp [K] </TH> <TH> Optics Temp [K]</TH> </TR>


7) Go to the directory where the FITS files were zipped. Zip them into one or more archive (max size: 500 MB).

8) Post to the wiki:
a) Create a new page linked from http://zero.as.arizona.edu/groups/clio2usermanual/wiki/92355/Calibration_Data__2014B.html
b) Post the text file, the FITS files Zip Archive, and the table from the HTML.
Example Template for the Top Matter in the wiki page:

<h1>clio_20141103_04</h1>
<div>
<h2>FITS Files:</h2></div>
<div>
<h2>File Listing:</h2></div>
<div>Get this table as a text file:</div>




-Katie Morzinski, 2015 Jan. 13
